curriculum_stages.name: Basic Hit/Stand Strategy
curriculum_stages.description: Learn basic hitting and standing strategies. The agent should learn when to hit (draw a card) and when to stand (stay with the current hand) based on its hand value and the dealer's upcard. Agent must start to beat random play.

curriculum_stages.name: Adding Double Down
curriculum_stages.description: Introduce the 'Double Down' action. The agent learns when it's advantageous to double its bet and take only one additional card. The agent must now integrate understanding of risk/reward ratio and favorable starting hands.

curriculum_stages.name: Split Decision
curriculum_stages.description: Introduce the 'Split' action. The agent learns when to split a pair into two separate hands to maximize potential winnings. Complex strategy here requires the agent to reason about conditional probabilities given specific pairs and dealer's upcard.

curriculum_stages.name: Full Blackjack Strategy
curriculum_stages.description: Integrate all available actions. Master the full blackjack strategy, combining hitting, standing, doubling down, and splitting to achieve optimal play.  Agent must learn to balance short-term risks for long-term reward, as splitting increases variance.
